head.title: Pennsylvania: Falling Totem Pole Kills Boy Scout

hedline.hl1: Pennsylvania: Falling Totem Pole Kills Boy Scout
hedline.hl2: Pennsylvania: Falling Totem Pole Kills Boy Scout

block.p: A 13-foot totem pole fell on Sunday and struck and killed a 9-year-old boy on the first day of Boy Scout camp in Loysville, the police said. The boy, Tyler O. Shope, of Shermans Dale, died of head and chest injuries, said Michael Shalonis, the Perry County coroner. The boy was waiting outside the camp's health lodge to have his health records reviewed at the time of the accident, officials said.
